intro: Pentataxis micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved star-twist, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, narrow, and often have a slight pubescence, contributing to its ornamental value. Pentataxis micrantha is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
